info.title: Brightcove Analytics API Reference
info.description: Reference for the Brightcove Analytics API, used to retrieve analytics data for your accounts. To test API requests, you can use our API Testing Tools.

get.description: Get a summary report of engagement for the account. Note:  Engagement reports are only available for periods within the past 32 days. Requests outside that range will return an error The only parameters supported for Engagement reports are from and to Engagement reports are available for single accounts only - reports on multiple accounts will not work

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description:
BAD_REQUEST: The message fields of the response contains information about what caused the error such as invalid value for sort parameter 
UNSUPPORTED_FIELD_COMBINATION_ERROR: The message fields of the response contains information about what invalid fields were specifed

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Authentication failed; check to make sure your policy key is correct

404.description: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

405.description: METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED: This error occurs when the api request is made with an HTTP method other than GET

500.description:
SERVER_ERROR: Issue in Brightcove system; try again later 
PROCESSING: The analytics API may send back this message if it encounters a long running query. Once the query has finished it will be stored in the server’s cache for up to 5 minutes. Therefore we suggest querying the API 4 minutes after receiving this error

get.description: Get a summary report of engagement for a player. Note:  Engagement reports are only available for periods within the past 32 days. Requests outside that range will return an error The only parameters supported for Engagement reports are from and to Engagement reports are available for single accounts only - reports on multiple accounts will not work

get.description: Get an analytics report on one or more dimensions. Note that the fields returned in the response will vary according to the dimension(s) requested and the fields specified in the fields parameter

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description:
BAD_REQUEST: The message fields of the response contains information about what caused the error such as invalid value for sort parameter 
UNSUPPORTED_FIELD_COMBINATION_ERROR: The message fields of the response contains information about what invalid fields were specifed

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Authentication failed; check to make sure your policy key is correct

404.description: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

405.description: METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED: This error occurs when the api request is made with an HTTP method other than GET

500.description:
SERVER_ERROR: Issue in Brightcove system; try again later 
PROCESSING: The analytics API may send back this message if it encounters a long running query. Once the query has finished it will be stored in the server’s cache for up to 5 minutes. Therefore we suggest querying the API 4 minutes after receiving this error

get.description: Get the date range for which reconciled data is available for any Analytics API report. All parameters are allowed, but only account, dimensions, and where affect the result — all others are ignored. Note that date range for this request must fall within the available date range for the dimensions requested — the simplest thing to do is to use from=alltime

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

get.description: returns the total alltime video views for a video

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: The message fields of the response contains information about what caused the error such as invalid value for sort parameter

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Authentication failed; check to make sure your policy key is correct

404.description: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

405.description: METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED: This error occurs when the api request is made with an HTTP method other than GET

500.description: SERVER_ERROR: Issue in Brightcove system; try again later

from.description: Start time for the period covered by the report — epoch time in milliseconds or a date in the format yyyy-mm-dd (such as 2013-09-26)

to.description: End time for the period covered by the report — epoch time in milliseconds or a date in the format yyyy-mm-dd (such as 2013-09-26)

accounts.description: one or more Video Cloud account IDs separated by commas

offset.description: number of videos to skip in the response

sort.description: field to sort results by (for video dimension reports, valid sort fields include the video metadata fields video.name, video.tags, video.reference_id and video.custom_fields - see (Fields and Sort))

fields.description: fields to return for items; see Dimensions and Fields for the available fields for each dimension

dimensions.description: one or more dimensions to report on; see Multiple Dimensions for which combined dimensions are supported

where.description: one or more dimension==value pairs to filter the results; see Where Filters for details

format.description: format to return the results in

reconciled.description: if true, only reconciled data is returned; if false, only realtime data is returned; if not present, both reconciled and realtime data are returned

ad_mode_begin.description: Total ad mode begin events received for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

ad_mode_complete.description: Total ad mode complete events received for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

bytes_delivered.description: Total bytes of data delivered for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

engagement_score.description: Average engagement score for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

play_rate.description: Average play rate for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

play_request.description: Total play requests for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_engagement_1.description: Average views at 1% point for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_engagement_25.description: Average views at 25% point for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_engagement_50.description: Average views at 50% point for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_engagement_75.description: Average views at 75% point for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_engagement_100.description: Average views at 100% point for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_impression.description: Total video impressions for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

video_view.description: Total video views for all items - note that properties included in the summary vary depending on the dimension(s) and fields requested

type.description: type of data in the values array

values.description: array of views in each 100th part of video duration

item_count.description: the total number of items matching the request

items.description: array of analytics objects for the videos returned

summary.description: of all videos matching this request that had views

video_engagement_1.description: number of views at the 1% point of the video duration for all videos

video_engagement_25.description: number of views at the 25% point of the video duration for all videos

video_engagement_50.description: number of views at the 50% point of the video duration for all videos

video_engagement_75.description: number of views at the 75% point of the video duration for all videos

video_engagement_100.description: number of views at the 100% point of the video duration for all videos

name.description: the name of the Video Cloud account id

ad_mode_begin.description: number of times a player entered ad mode

ad_mode_complete.description: number of times a player completed ad mode

bytes_delivered.description: the total bytes of data delivered, including the videos, other assets such as images and captions, and (for player reports) the player code — some of the date is obtained from CDNs and may not be available for up to 3 days

engagement_score.description: the calculated engagement score for the video

play_rate.description: video views divided by video impressions

play_request.description: number of play requests received for a video

duration.description: the duration of the video in seconds

video_engagement_1.description: number of views at the 1% point of the video duration

video_engagement_25.description: number of views at the 25% point of the video duration

video_engagement_50.description: number of views at the 50% point of the video duration

video_engagement_75.description: number of views at the 75% point of the video duration

video_engagement_100.description: number of views at the 100% point of the video duration

video_impression.description: number of times the video was loaded in a player

video_percent_viewed.description: average percentage of the video played when viewed

video_seconds_viewed.description: total seconds of the video viewed

video_view.description: number of times some portion of the video was viewed

reconciled_from.description: the earliest date that you can use for from and get reconciled data

reconciled_to.description: the latest date that you can use for to and get reconciled data (realtime data may be available for later dates)
